page.title: 09Building Materials-Epping GR
page.content: A SURVEY OF THE BUILDINGS IN THE AREA PROVIDED A NUMBER OF INTERESTING STYLES AND MATERIALS. THE AREA DOES NOT HAVE A PLENTIFUL SUPPLY OF STONE TO BE QUARRIED INN THE TRADITIONAL WAY.A METHOD OF BUILDING WAS DEVISED HUNDREDS OF YEARS AGO TO MAKE USE OF THE FLINT CHUNKS THAT ARE FOUND JUST BELOW THE SURFACE OVER THE ENTIRE AREA. KNOWN AS "FLINT RUBBLE" THE BUILDINGS CONSTRUCTED FROM THIS MATERIAL HAVE A VERY DISTINCTIVE APPEARANCE.AN EXCELLENT EXAMPLE OF THIS METHOD IS TO BE FOUND IN THE PARISH CHURCH OF NAZEING .THE ORIGINAL CHURCH BUILT AROUND 1060 OF STONE OBTAINED FROM THE RIVER LEE,STILL STANDS TODAY.
